detailed_profile.name: Reza B'Far
detailed_profile.position: Group Vice President of Development at Oracle
detailed_profile.about: Building and creating is what fuels me. I pride myself in my ability to manage tough projects, tough teams, building great products, using my technical chops and management skills. I was doing AI since before it was cool and have a breadth of technology understanding from the user down to quantum physics of transistors. I have led or been part of teams building systems using artificial intelligence (HTN Planners, ML, Heuristic Search), software-as-service, mobile computing, security/privacy, multi-modal user interfaces, medical computing (specifically imaging and assisted diagnostics)... My management expertise include building several product lines from seed to infancy to maturity within large companies such as Oracle, reorganizing development startup teams at mid-size companies such as LogicalApps, and being part of the founding team at companies such as Voice Genesis. I hold more than 40 finalized US Patents, 2 International Patents, and 6 Pending US Patents in various areas including artificial intelligence, mobile computing, A.I. applied to health-care, and massively scalable systems. I remain active in research and publishing with applications of AI (ML, SAT Solvers, etc.), Graph Theory, Game Theory, Adversarial Search, and Search Optimization

patents.title: Techniques for Extracting Semantic Data Stores
patents.description: Embodiments of the present invention include techniques for enforcing policies. In accordance with an embodiment, a method for enforcing policies includes storing a first set of data in at least one first data store, defining a plurality of semantic concepts of an ontology, constructing a map from the first set of data to the semantic concepts, executing the map to form a second set of data according to the ontology, and reasoning the ontology to determine compliance with one or more policies.The at least one first data store may comprise a plurality of data stores and the method may include reformatting at least a portion of the first set of data. For example, the at least one first data store may include a relational database that has at least one table and the method may include denormalizing the at least one table. In addition, executing the map may include filtering the first set of data in order to restrain the size of the second set of data. A trigger may be defined and the map may be executed when the conditions for the trigger are fulfilled. Executing the map may include transforming the second set of data into another format, such as format optimized for use by a reasoning engine.In accordance with another embodiment, at least one computer readable medium, having stored collectively thereon instructions for causing at least one processor to perform a method of enforcing policies is disclosed. The instructions include instructions for storing a first set of data in at least one first data store, for defining a plurality of semantic concepts for an ontology, for constructing a map from said data to said semantic concepts, for executing said map to transform said first set of data into a second set of data, for storing said second set of data in a second data store according to said ontology, and for reasoning said second set of data to determine compliance with one or more policies.

patents.title: Representation of Operations for Making Changes to a Graph
patents.description: An embodiment provides a system to generate visualization layouts. A timeline upon which a playhead indicator is moved or positioned. Changes to a displayed visualization (such as a node-edge graph) that are within a predetermined interval of the playhead indicator's time position are shown graphically on or near the graph. Actor icons are positioned on or near the displayed graph. The actor icons correspond to different entities (e.g., a person, group, organization, software agent, etc.) that has made a change to the graph. Change indicators both on the timeline and in association with the actor icons can be color-coded to indicate addition, deletion, modification or other operations to graph items or to other objects being displayed.One embodiment provides a method for displaying a layout of at least a portion of a node-edge graph, wherein the layout changes over time according to operations performed on the node-edge graph, the node-edge graph including nodes coupled by edges, the method comprising: representing an operation as a tuple of operation type, data tuple, actor and time, wherein the operation type describes a type of operation performed on a data item, wherein the data tuple specifies an item that is the subject of the operation type, wherein actor identifies an entity that is changed the graph by causing the operation on the data item, and wherein the time specifies a time at which the operation occurred; determining a time interval; identifying the operations that occurred within the time interval; and using the operation representations to generate a display of a layout that changes over the time interval.

patents.title: Techniques for display of information related to policies
patents.description: In an embodiment, a computer-implemented method of displaying information is disclosed. A policy violation is identified based at least in part on data stored in a data store. A plurality of semantic objects related to the policy violation are identified and an arrangement of graphical representations of the semantic objects is caused to be displayed, where the arrangement indicates one or more relationships between one or more pairs of the semantic objects.The arrangement may include a graph comprising a plurality of nodes and one or more edges connecting at least a subset of the nodes, and each of the plurality of nodes may to at least one of the semantic objects. At least one of the one or more edges between a particular pair of nodes may indicate a direction between the particular pair of nodes, and the direction may indicate a characteristic of a relationship between semantic objects corresponding to the particular pair.In an embodiment, the method includes for one or more of the semantic objects, identifying one or more workflows related to the one or more semantic objects and causing the display of a workflow representation with the arrangement. The method may also include assigning attributes to one or more of the semantic objects, and wherein one or more of the graphical representations have one or more visual characteristics corresponding to one or more of the assigned attributes. At least one of the graphical representations, in an embodiment, represents a set of the semantic objects, and the method may include receiving selection of said at least one graphical representations and causing display of second graphical representations of the set of graphical representations in a second arrangement indicative of one or more second relationships between one or more pairs of the set of semantic objects. At least a portion of the arrangement may represent a Baysian network.

patents.title: Heuristic Caching to Personalize Applications
patents.description: Techniques for heuristic caching of application data are disclosed herein. In an embodiment, a computer-implemented method of heuristic caching is disclosed, The computer-implemented method may be used to facilitate navigation in an electronic environment. The method may include: identifying a plurality of potential user interface transitions available to a user; selecting, based at least in part on data specific to the user and data regarding a plurality of other users, a subset of the identified potential user interface transitions available to the user; and causing one or more actions to be taken that result in acceleration of one or more transitions of the selected subset upon selection by the user.In the computer-implemented method, identifying the plurality of potential user interface transitions available to the user may include identifying, from a current user interface state, a plurality of selectable user interface elements, where each element is selectable to cause navigation to a corresponding user interface state. The data specific to the user may be a user type and the data regarding the plurality of other users may comprise data aggregated based at least in part on past navigational behavior of one or more users having the user type. The data specific to the user may also include data determined based at least in part on past navigational behavior of the user. In an embodiment, selecting the subset of the identified potential user interface transitions includes: ordering the plurality of user interface transitions based at least in part on the data specific to the user and the data regarding the plurality of other users; and selecting the subset based at least in part on positions in the ordered plurality of user interface transitions of members of the subset.

patents.title: Temporal Graph Visualization
patents.description: An embodiment provides a timeline upon which a playhead indicator is moved or positioned. Changes to a displayed graph that are within a predetermined interval of the playhead indicator's time position are shown graphically on or near the graph. Actor icons are positioned on or near the displayed graph. The actor icons correspond to different entities (e.g., a person, group, organization, software agent, etc.) that has made a change to the graph. Change indicators both on the timeline and in association with the actor icons can be color-coded to indicate addition, deletion, modification or other operations to graph items or to other objects being displayed.

patents.title: EMPLOYEE WELLNESS TRACKING AND RECOMMENDATIONS USING WEARABLE DEVICES AND HUMAN RESOURCE (HR) DATA
patents.description: Embodiments of the invention provide systems and methods for wellness tracking and recommendations. More specifically, embodiments of the present invention provide wellness applications that integrate wearable devices with Human Resource (HR) and other enterprise application data. According to one embodiment, providing integrated wellness information can comprise retrieving enterprise application data from one or more data sources, retrieving data from one or more wearable devices of one or more employees, and applying analytics to the retrieved enterprise application data and the data retrieved from the wearable devices. The integrated wellness information can be generated based on the applied analytics and can be provided to the one or more employees through a user interface.

patents.title: Defense against Search Engine Tracking
patents.description: Techniques for enhancing electronic privacy are disclosed herein. In an embodiment, a computer-implemented method for enhancing electronic privacy is disclosed. The method includes obtaining search query information regarding search queries that have been submitted to a search engine computer system by a user computer system of a user; generating, based at least in part on the obtained search query information, noise information; and providing the generated noise information to an application in a manner enabling the application to submit, on behalf of the user, search queries to the search engine that are based at least in part on the provided generated noise information. For example, generating the noise information may include, for each search query of at least a subset of the search queries: identifying a keyword of the search query; and determining one or more keywords that are semantically similar to the identified keyword. The noise information may indicate the determined one or more keywords. As another example, obtaining the search query information may include receiving from the user computer system the search query information over a computer network, such as the Internet. The noise information may encode search queries and a schedule for submitting the search queries to the search engine computer system. Providing the generated noise information may enable the user computer system to submit the search queries to the search engine without requiring a specific instruction from the user for each submission of the search queries, in other words, upon receipt of the noise information, no user input may be necessary for the search queries to be submitted to the search engine. Obtained search query information may include information from search results returned by the search engine.

patents.title: Techniques for application tuning
patents.description: Techniques for tuning systems generate configurations that are used to test the systems to determine optimal configurations for the systems. The configurations for a system are generated to allow for effective testing of the system while remaining within budgetary and/or resource constraints. The configurations may be selected to satisfy one or more conditions on their distributions to ensure that a satisfactory set of configurations are tested. Machine learning techniques may be used to create models of systems and those models can be used to determine optimal configurations.

patents.title: Application configuration generation
patents.description: Techniques for tuning systems generate configurations that are used to test the systems to determine optimal configurations for the systems. patents.title: Algorithmic method for generating a medical utilization profile for a patient and to be used for medical risk analysis decisioning
patents.description: The present invention is an algorithmic method for generating a medical utilization profile for a patient to facilitate decision making in the medical risk analyses, wherein the algorithmic method is comprised of four key components: (1) key independent variables recognized including medical data sources; (2) an ontology based process to organize these variables; (3) rules (probability distributions etc.) that can be used to draw correlative information from the given data and its ontological organization; and (4) usage of reasoning engines to process the gathered information and draw inferences.Specifically, the algorithmic method is comprised of the following step: (a) determining medical data sources which contain medical data of said patient; (b) applying reasoning engines to define an initial ontology model which matches said data sources; (c) creating an ontology implementation that includes characterization, classification of said medical date in a given analysis sequence; (d) enabling said initial ontology model to thereby modify said initial model; and (e) comparing the initial ontology model with the modified ontology model through a Set Theory including comparing with intersections and unions which yields results to drive business rules.

patents.title: Techniques for Semantic Business Policy Composition
patents.description: Embodiments of the present invention relate to techniques for creating policies. A plurality of objects representative of semantic objects are provided to a user. An arrangement of a subset of the objects, the arrangement representative of a policy, is received. The arrangement is converted to instructions for implementation by an application configured to implement policies. One or more of the objects may include fields and/or controls for specifying criteria of semantic objects represented by the objects.

patents.title: Generic Ontology Based Semantic Business Policy Engine
patents.description: Techniques for implementing policies. In an embodiment, first data is stored in a first data store according to a first schema. A second schema is defined based at least in part on a policy and an ontology. Second data, which includes at least a portion of the first data, is stored in a second data store according to the second schema. Storing the second data is based at least in part on a mapping of the first schema to the second schema. At least a portion of the second data is analyzed and results of the analysis are provided to a user.

patents.title: Algorithmic Method for Generating a Medical Utilization Profile for a Patient and to be Used for Medical Risk Analysis Decisioning
patents.description: An algorithmic method for generating a medical utilization profile for a patient to facilitate decision making in the medical risk analyses, wherein the algorithmic method is comprised of four key components: (1) key independent variables recognized including medical data sources; (2) an ontology based process to organize these variables; (3) rules (probability distributions etc.) that can be used to draw correlative information from the given data and its ontological organization; and (4) usage of reasoning engine to process the gathered information and draw inferences.

patents.title: Omnimodal messaging system
patents.description: A messaging server application system handles message creation, receipt, and response for any sort of digitizable message in any format. It typically operates as a core application and application infrastructure in a communications network or networks in the multiple sender, receiver and user modes of the same or varying design and operational characteristics. The system uses an application architecture organized using a set of ten loosely-coupled subsystems falling into three general functional groups: interface/connector subsystems, core subsystems, and storage subsystems. The interface/connector subsystems include voice, data and multimedia gateways as well as message connectors and a multimodal authenticator. The core subsystems include a multimedia messaging bus, an independent metadata messaging bus, and a content transformer. The storage subsystem can include various storage subsystems.

patents.title: Reputation-based auditing of enterprise application authorization models
patents.description: Embodiments of the invention provide systems and methods for reputation-based auditing of enterprise application authorized models. Reputation metrics can be used to gauge risk of individuals to an organization, such as employees of a business. The reputation metrics may be calculated from both internal and external data sources, including social network profiles of the individuals. Calculations of risk can be used to make determinations regarding the activities the individuals are authorized to engage in.Stated another way, managing authorization policies of an enterprise based on reputation auditing of employees of the enterprise can comprise obtaining information associated with an employee of the enterprise from each of a plurality of data sources. The plurality of data sources can include at least one data source internal to the enterprise and at least one data source external to the enterprise. Stored reputation information for the employee can be accessed, the reputation information including one or more reputation metrics. The one or more reputation metrics can indicate an influence of the employee to a risk to the enterprise associated with the employee. The one or more reputation metrics for the employee can be updated based on the obtained information and a determination can be made as to whether to update one or more authorization policies of the enterprise based at least in part on the updated one or more reputation metrics for the employee.

patents.title: Massively Scalable Reasoning Architecture
patents.description: Techniques for reasoning data are disclosed. The techniques may include storing data in a data store which may be a semantic data store. A plurality of reasoning modules are used to reason the data in order to detect violations of one or more business policies. The reasoning modules may include semantic reasoning modules and/or pattern-based reasoning modules. Results of reasoning the data may be displayed to one or more users

detailed_profile.name: Alfred Cervantes
detailed_profile.position: Helping Constructors Deliver On-Time & Under Budget @ Oracle | Experienced Manager and Lover of People
detailed_profile.about: People are my passion, and I love it when bright minds come together to create solutions to pains. I am currently working as a Sales Development Representative for Oracle's Construction & Engineering Business Unit, focusing on Scheduling, Collaboration, and Project Management. Learning about the industry has turned construction into a passion for me, so if you have a project you want to speak about, my door is open to listen. Please reach out to alfred.cervantes@oracle.com or call 512-671-5395. An experienced team leader for SaaS products, my skills include customer service management, data analytics, insight implementation, cross-functional team management, product roadmap strategy, and reporting to C-suite executives/stakeholders, writing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), direct sales, outbound sales, inside sales and account management. Graduate from the University of Houston's Bauer College of Business and the Cyvia & Melvyn Wolff Center for Entrepreneurship in May 2020, with a Bachelors of Business Administration in Entrepreneurship and Marketing. The Wolff Center for Entrepreneurship is ranked the #1 undergraduate entrepreneurship program in the nation. Enjoys learning and creating new things, Chess, a good hike, close friends, a thought-provoking conversation, The Beatles, and his dog, Baxter. My favorite book is The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho. Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill is a close second. Projects - Eat Lo-Cal H-Town - meal prep startup, founded in 2016 - Baxter's Boxers - Boxer shorts with pockets for men and women, founded in 2017 - PepGen Tech LLC - Lung cancer early diagnostic test, founded in 2019 - Chess-Table LLC - The only Chess/Coffee table, founded in 2022. chess-table.com - CEO, Bill's Backyard Wolffest Team - 16 classmates, 80+ volunteers, Best Culture award, Wolffest 2020. - and more

Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) is a start-up environment, I wear many hats. Some of the hats:
- Business Development - Develop plans to increase our revenue story for Oracle cloud

positions.subtitle: Microsoft
positions.description: - I managed the cloud growth for SQL Azure, DocDB, Exchange, and Exchange Online Protection. This means I educate these partner teams on how to cost-effectively and scalably grow their server footprint in our MSFT datacenters. It's a fun combination of strategically planning for the business years in advance, and tactically handling time-sensitive problems to ensure their current capacity meets their business needs. - I am also my team's primary "data guy". We create reams upon reams (old metaphor, I know) of data. I take the role of using it to determine how effectively we are managing our cloud capacity and where we can improve our performance. If you can measure it, you can improve it. I spend a lot of time writing one-pagers for new metrics and initiatives. The model I tend to favor is to create the proof of concepts myself and then hand those off to a different team to maintain. "Fail fast" is a personal philosophy of mine. - Planning is an exciting place to be in the cloud because it is so cross-functional. I spend a majority of my days interacting with cross-functional teams with different goals, targets, and priorities; I work to find the best way to solve problems with these different goals and ambitions in mind.

projects.title: Project Renegade - Smart Space
projects.description: Project Renegade was based on the concept that user should have analytic information at their fingertips and on the desktop without having to go seek it out. The project was also based on the idea that browser based applications did not provide the interaction or the simplicity that users demanded. Users needed mini-applications that gave them the information that they precisely needed and allowed them to launch into more detail with broader browser based applications. This was created during a short era when desktop gadgets were all the rage http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yahoo!_Widgets and therefore the concepts overlapped. This project quickly became a product but slowly faded into maintenance with the demise of desktop gadgets and the rise of app store applications.http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/middleware/smart-space/overview/smart-space-1-124550.jpghttp://www.information-management.com/news/1070656-1.htmlhttp://www.itp.net/5067-hyperions-smart-move-in-bi-space/?tab=article#.Ujh8rRaRi-I

projects.title: OLAP Underground
projects.description: Co-founded the OLAP Underground and created many Essbase utilities free to use for customers. Some of the products include, Essbase Outline Extractor, Essbase PowerBar, and Essbase Security Manager. These tools have been given to a partner who maintains them and many are in use today.

projects.title: Smart View Concept to Product (HOAS - Hyperion Office Analysis Service)
projects.description: Created a concept Office add-in for BI (Essbase) and EPM (HFM and Planning) data sources. The project, at the time named HOAS - Hyperion Office Analysis Service, was based on the idea that financial end users wanted to access their data from Office with out the constraints of IT exports or web browser restrictions (it was 2004). For the project we created an XML exchange over HTTP with similar rules as REST before REST gained acceptance. The prototype was demoed at the Hyperion Solutions conference in Chicago (04/2004) with much fan-fair. The prototype quickly moved in to product mode and was delivered as a product in 2005 and is still a critical product in both EPM and BI.

recommendations: Uma Sabada “Anders is one of the smartest engineer I have worked with. Anders is a versatile, stand-out engineer with rock solid work ethics, clean design ideas, and a keen attention to detail. He is a quick learner and a great team player - willing to work on any area as demanded by the project. The team members value his technical ability and input and often ask him to review their code checkins or design docs. His technical expertise, communication skills, and drive makes him a valuable team member. Anders is also very involved in mentoring and grooming interns and new college graduates. He proactively recommends projects and meets with new employees both one-on-one and in groups to facilitate their quick ramp up. Anders is knowledgeable, approachable, and a great role model - a cornerstone member for any team looking to hire top talent and grow. I highly recommend Anders Swanson.”

Brad Root “Anders is an intelligent & exceptionally talented cloud software engineer and technical leader with a high aptitude for picking up new technologies, tools, and processes quickly. He reported to me and was responsible for the development, deployment, and support of infrastructure and several Java-based microservices in the enterprise security management platform group's threat event processing stack. As an intern on my team, Anders exceeded expectations as he rapidly learned to develop and deploy microservices and became a go-to expert for containers and Kubernetes. His impact and performance led to a full-time position on my team and over the following two years, Anders's growth, fueled by his initiative and ambition, continued to accelerate: He added new microservices, made process improvements to the CI/CD pipeline, introduced new technologies to improve supportability and developer adoption of the stack, significantly reduced costs of operating services in AWS, and much more. Anders also demonstrated technical leadership; he provided design and integration guidance to external teams and successfully mentored two interns whom each made meaningful contributions to our production stack and later provided overwhelmingly positive feedback regarding their experience working with Anders. Anders is highly regarded by this peers, architects, principal engineers, and other engineering leaders in his group. He is a pleasure to work and can be trusted to complete his tasks, with high quality, and communicate regularly with his team. He's an extraordinary engineer, an up-and-coming technical leader, and would be a welcomed asset to any high-performing team. I'm looking forward to following Anders as he continues progress in his career.”

recommendations: Logan Frost “I had the opportunity to work with Liza at Gartner on numerous campus recruiting trips throughout the Midwest. During our time as colleagues our recruiting trips were constantly defined by Liza’s professionalism, grace and wit. It can be overwhelming managing just the expectations of one professor, student or campus, let alone dozens throughout a territory. Nevertheless each time I coordinated with Liza we were met with excitement at each college campus we visited. This is a testament to the relationships she builds and the value she brings in every interaction. This excitement was seen at every level, across students, clubs, professors and schools. Her energy and goodwill to others is palpable and magnetic. The last defining characteristic I want to highlight is Liza’s compassion and empathy. When dealing with college graduates and young professionals there is often times quite a bit riding on a job offer. Regardless of her ability to offer a certain candidate a job Liza always ensured the students she worked with felt empowered, confident and proud of their backgrounds and experiences. She constantly works to find and align opportunities within her network to further support those around her. She is a pleasure to be around personally and professionally and will make incredibly contributions to whatever team is fortunate to have her. ”

detailed_profile.name: Prasad Thota
detailed_profile.about: At OCI, I support engineering org building next generation virtual cloud networking…
recommendations: Namendra Kumar “Prasad and I have worked together for a long time on the various iterations of Microsoft's Real Time Communication products (Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Lync, Office Communications Server). In everything we have partnered on, I have found Prasad to be thorough, diligent, dependable and most-importantly level-headed & calm. I have seen Prasad take on struggling teams and improving their performance, I have seen Prasad handle burning issues with a unique mixture of speed & aplomb. Under his leadership, the Voice Applications area powering a big portion of Teams Voice scale to astronomical numbers, and Teams Telephony extended to many new markets & scenarios. While doing all this, Prasad always finds time to create personal bond, and show genuine care for his reports as well as his peers. I still remember when my then manager introduced me to Prasad many many years back. He had said, "Meet Prasad, he is a great guy who will always help you", and over more than a decade, he has done just that, and I am grateful to have such a colleague & friend.”

Rob Young “Prasad is an inciteful, empathetic, and highly effective engineering leader who understands what it takes to bring people together to deliver on large ambitious projects. I had to opportunity to work with Prasad over a 3 year period as our respective teams built out the services powering enterprise PSTN capabilities that power Microsoft Teams and Azure Communications Services today. While I admired Prasad’s engineering skills and domain expertise in routing and networking, it was his ability to empathize and build a culture of trust that impressed me the most. Prasad’s contributions were fundamental in attracting, retaining, and growing the capability of our talent as we scaled up. Prasad’s leadership spanned core dev, QA and operations teams and he was ever present to support his teams during key services incidents or other challenging situations. Prasad is highly capable and genuinely cares about the people and outcomes he is accountable for - I’d recommend him for any engineering leadership role without hesitation.”

recommendations: David Thayer “Jason is truly one of a kind. He’s highly skilled at identifying critical problems for a business, creating a plan to address them and motivating a team to solve them. As a leader, Jason stands out because he cares so much. About the people on his teams. About cutting through politics and short-term thinking. And about the impact he and the people he empowers have. Jason’s hitting his stride leading big, difficult, cross-functional projects now and I’m excited to see him continue to have a larger and larger impact in the world.”

rui jiang “I worked closely with Jason on a project to rewrite a very complex legacy business application. Jason always has long term vision for the product and the technology to build the product. recommendations: Bekki Early “I worked on the same small, nimble, over-achieving team as Mackenzie for years, and had the great privilege and FUN (!) to partner with her on a number of strategic initiatives as well as one-off projects and events. I worked with Mackenzie long enough to know that she is the ultimate team player, and a gift to any squad: consistent, professional, thorough, thoughtful, takes tremendous pride in execution and team success. Even when Mackenzie's and my reporting lines changed due to a company restructuring, she was still someone I continued to reach out to and partner with cross-functionally because her expertise shines well beyond her areas of focus. An asset to any team, a rare talent, and a friend on my short list of people to call when life throws a curve ball.”

Israel Campbell (He/Him) “If you are looking for a leader that will develop, support, and enhance team dynamics, you need Mackenzie Kaplan. Mackenzie has helped lead our philanthropy team at Equinix for years, and developed programs that continue to engage, encourage and elevate employees. I worked closely with Mackenzie in our global programs, where she challenged the team to think beyond their surroundings and create relatable and accessible content for our employees. Mackenzie shines in teaching and developing the team she leads and leads in service to everyone on the team. Any company would be honored to have you, and I am honored to have worked with you.”

volunteer_experience.info: My mission is to ensure every Courageous Kid battling cancer feels supported throughout their journey. Together in partnership with Equinix, Verizon, and the hundreds of friends and family members, we’ve created over 10,000 cards for children to NEGU (which stands for Never Ever Give Up)! Through virtual volunteer care card sessions, we’re amplifying awareness and educating everyone about expressing empathy and care for others, especially these remarkable and Courageous Kids!
